result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett M. Ely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant must enroll and participate in an anger management course and a psychological evaluation and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assesesed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Called at 10:20 AM. Also called 14CF41. Garrett Eli appears in person and in custody with attorney Amy Ferguson. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - have resolution. Ferguson - 13CF182 - defendant would plead NC to count #1 as alleged, #2 - dismissed; 14CF41 - DRI #1,  and defendant would plead NC to count #2 as alleged , joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and/or psychological, absolute sobreity, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or tavenrs, employment/school, 300 hours of community service, State to argue for 1 year conditional jail time and defense free to argue conditional jail time - will argue for 6 months. Bednar agrees. Garrett agrees. Court - 14CF41 - DRI #1, 13CF182 - dismiss count #2. Garrett pleads NC to count #1 as alleged on 13CF182 and NC to count #2 as alleged on 14CF41. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constititonal rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State has complied with victim notification requirements - makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 1 year in county jail as conditional jail time - otherwise follow joint recommendation. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 6 months conditional jail - otherwise follow joint recommendation - credit for 80 on each case days if revoked. Garrett makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF182 - count #1 - impose 3.5 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision - consecutive to any sentence that he currently is serving, stayed, place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 9 months in FC jail - huber allowed - credit for 80 days only if revoked - eligible for community service under probation provisions, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 300 hours of community service, enroll in anger management and psychological evaluation and follow thru, submit DNA with no surcharge assessed, costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample; 14CF81 - count #2 - impose 9 months in jail - consecutive to 13CF182, stayed, place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to 13CF182, with same conditions except no additional jail time or community service, costs, DNA surcharge, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Called at 3:33 PM. Also called 14CF41. Garrett Ely appears in person and with counsel Amy Ferguson. State appears by JBC. State calls Deputy Thomas Robinson on 13CF182. Robinson sworn in at 3:33 PM. Direct exam by State. Ferguson objects - hearsay - sustained (3:37 PM). State offers exhibit #1 - JOC from previous conviction of defendant. Court receives after no objections (3:40 PM). Court takes judicial notice of the exhibit. Cross exam by Ferguson at 3:41 PM. Ferguson objects - relevance - sustained (3:42 PM). Robinson excused at 3:43 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Ferguson has Information for 13CF182, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 6/18/14 at 10:00 AM. Proceed with PH on 14CF41. State calls Deputy Belland. Belland sworn in at 3:45 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Ferguson at 3:51 PM. Belland excused at 3:53 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Ferguson has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 6/18/14 at 10:00 AM.
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No unsupervised contact with MGV, DOB (4/9/03). refused to sign
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:55 am. Also called 13CF182. Garrett Ely appears in custody via video. Counsel Amy Ferugson in person. State appears by Charles Simon. Ferguson has complaint, waives reading. 14CF41 - state - bond - $1000 cash with no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Aiyana Vanzile or their child (MGV - 4/9/2003 DOB). Ferguson has issue with conditions requested - no problem with a no abusive contact with MGV, does have revocation proceedings. Court - $1000 cash and no unsupervised contact with MGV, DOB (4/9/03). State - bond - 13CF1825 - $1000 cash with no specific conditions. Court - bond - $1000 cash with no consumption of alcohol. Ferguson waiving time limits for PH's. Court considers time limits waived, set both cases for PH on 4/30/14 at 3:00 PM
